title: Safe Passage
subtitle:
Yesterday, in one afternoon, over 500 refugees & migrants arrived on the Greek island of Lesbos, in numbers not seen since 2015

These small islands can barely cope. One refugee camp & the largest in Europe, Moria, is holding 10,000 people despite only having capacity for 3,000 pic.twitter.com/aGe2Iqr8G7

subtitle: Lisburn, Bangor, Ards and Downpatrick Campuses !!!! Free of charge for refugees and asylum seekers @S_ERCpic.twitter.com/4AmrjyKAmO

title: Richard Williams
subtitle: A delivery driver has just asked about the refugees welcome poster in the window. Smiling, he said, “they didn’t have that 24 years ago”.   Originally from Sri Lanka, he applied for British citizenship last week. “Fingers crossed”, he said. Fingers crossed . #cityofsanctuarypic.twitter.com/ByiGPH6ZtB

title: PyrexPartyPixie
subtitle: The beauty wheel sounds fun.  Not so sure about the world envying English skin - mine is nothing but trouble although that could be all that non-English DNA! title: Help Refugees
subtitle:
Meet Sharon.

Sharon cares about protecting the earth and helping refugees. She’s a grandma. She’s also one of our most dedicated volunteers.

Sharon has salvaged items at festivals all summer - helping them avoid landfill and go to refugees who need them. 

Be like Sharon!  pic.twitter.com/uhZ64fHudT

subtitle:
I've had the best week driving across Europe with my ragtag band of lunatics. @OCC_Project received our car Matilda who will now go on to help refugees near Polykastro.

If anybody needs me I'm in Thessaloniki, falling in love with apparently *every* waitress. pic.twitter.com/LLjK3vo92v

title: Moulid Hujale
subtitle:
I'm honoured to be awarded "The Refugee Advocate of the Year" in the @somaliglamour’ Special Category 2019' 
I dedicate this Award to the 70 million people displaced globally. It's not just for their struggles but their survival and successes. #SomaliSuccess 
Thank you #SGA2019pic.twitter.com/Bj7qG4GEOx

title: UNHCR United Kingdom
subtitle:
By offering basic literacy and numeracy courses, the Borderless Centre in Beirut is part of a nationwide drive to get refugee children out of work and into school.

Fahed, 11, a Syrian refugee, has been able to stop working and start learning. #WithRefugeespic.twitter.com/jUyAIkYDT0

title: Caoimhe Butterly
subtitle:
Hawa from Ethiopia was one of those recently rescued by the #OpenArms SAR ship. Orphaned as a child, she grew up in a refugee camp in Sudan. She survived brutal violence in Libya and now hopes to get an education, work and to build a life of safety and dignity.

@openarms_fundpic.twitter.com/H7WFRgd4kE

title: IFMSA

title: Massimo Moratti

title: Fr Marc Lyden-Smith
subtitle: A powerful image of a Rohingya refugee mother and her child fleeing to Bangladesh, joined with an icon of The Holy Family, a reminder that they were also refugees as they fled to Egypt to escape bloodshed too. pic.twitter.com/xxyn0KJ2QX
